segment.source: How to Install the Client by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Install the Client by Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Install the Client by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Install the Client by Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Install the Client by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Install the Client by Using the Command Line

segment.source: The topics in this section include procedures to install either the Application Virtualization (App-V) Desktop Client or the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services) by using either setup.exe or setup.msi.
segment.target: The topics in this section include procedures to install either the Application Virtualization (App-V) Desktop Client or the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services) by using either setup.exe or setup.msi.

segment.source: Administrative rights are required to run either setup program.
segment.target: Administrative rights are required to run either setup program.

segment.source: You can use optional command-line parameters to apply specific configuration settings to the App-V client during the installation.
segment.target: You can use optional command-line parameters to apply specific configuration settings to the App-V client during the installation.

segment.source: For more information about using parameters, see Application Virtualization Client Installer Command-Line Parameters.
segment.target: For more information about using parameters, see Application Virtualization Client Installer Command-Line Parameters.

segment.source: If you have applied registry settings to a computer before deploying a client—for example, by using Group Policy—these settings are retained and any additional command line parameters are applied.
segment.target: If you have applied registry settings to a computer before deploying a client—for example, by using Group Policy—these settings are retained and any additional command line parameters are applied.

segment.source: Command line parameter values will replace any existing value for the same setting.
segment.target: Command line parameter values will replace any existing value for the same setting.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When you install the App-V client to use with a read-only cache, for example with a VDI server implementation, you must set the AUTOLOADTARGET parameter to NONE to prevent the client from trying to update applications when the cache is read-only.
segment.target: When you install the App-V client to use with a read-only cache, for example with a VDI server implementation, you must set the AUTOLOADTARGET parameter to NONE to prevent the client from trying to update applications when the cache is read-only.

segment.source: For more information about setting these parameter values after installation, see How to Configure the App-V Client Registry Settings by Using the Command Line (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=169355) in the Application Virtualization (App-V) Operations Guide.
segment.target: For more information about setting these parameter values after installation, see How to Configure the App-V Client Registry Settings by Using the Command Line (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=169355) in the Application Virtualization (App-V) Operations Guide.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If a configuration setting on the user’s computer depends on the client installation path, note that the Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 client copies its installation files to a different folder than previous versions did.
segment.target: If a configuration setting on the user’s computer depends on the client installation path, note that the Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 client copies its installation files to a different folder than previous versions did.

segment.source: By default, a new installation of the App-V 4.5 client will copy its installation files to the Program FilesMicrosoft Application Virtualization Client folder.
segment.target: By default, a new installation of the App-V 4.5 client will copy its installation files to the Program FilesMicrosoft Application Virtualization Client folder.

segment.source: If an earlier version of the client is already installed, running the App-V 4.5 client installer will perform an upgrade of the existing client using the existing installation folder.
segment.target: If an earlier version of the client is already installed, running the App-V 4.5 client installer will perform an upgrade of the existing client using the existing installation folder.

segment.source: Template Token Value
segment.target: Template Token Value

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For App-V version 4.6 and later, when the App-V client is installed, SFTLDR.DLL is copied to the Windowssystem32 directory.
segment.target: For App-V version 4.6 and later, when the App-V client is installed, SFTLDR.DLL is copied to the Windowssystem32 directory.

segment.source: If the App-V client is installed on a 64-bit system, SFTLDRWOW64.DLL is copied to the WindowsSysWOW64 directory.
segment.target: If the App-V client is installed on a 64-bit system, SFTLDRWOW64.DLL is copied to the WindowsSysWOW64 directory.

segment.source: Template Token Value
segment.target: Template Token Value

segment.source: In This Section
segment.target: In This Section

segment.source: The following topics describe how to install either the Application Virtualization (App-V) Desktop Client or the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services) by using either setup.exe or setup.msi.
segment.target: The following topics describe how to install either the Application Virtualization (App-V) Desktop Client or the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services) by using either setup.exe or setup.msi.

segment.source: How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.exe
segment.target: How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.exe

segment.source: Provides a step-by-step procedure for installing the App-V client by using the setup.exe program.
segment.target: Provides a step-by-step procedure for installing the App-V client by using the setup.exe program.

segment.source: How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.msi
segment.target: How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.msi

segment.source: Provides step-by-step procedures for installing any prerequisite software and also the App-V client by using the setup.msi program.
segment.target: Provides step-by-step procedures for installing any prerequisite software and also the App-V client by using the setup.msi program.
